text: The Restorer of Israel
But now thus says Yahweh,
he who created you, Jacob,
and he who formed you, Israel:
“You must not fear, for I have redeemed you.
I have called \add you\add* by your name; ⸤you are mine⸥.\f + \fr 43:1 \ft Literally “to me you” \f*
When you pass through the waters, I \add will be\add* with you,
and through the rivers, they shall not flow over you.
When you walk through fire, you shall not be burned,
and \add the\add* flame shall not scorch\f + \fr 43:2 \ft Or “burn” \f* you.
For I \add am\add* Yahweh, your God,
the holy one of Israel, your savior.
I give you Egypt \add as\add* ransom,
Cush and Seba in place of you.
Because you are precious in my eyes,
you are honored, and I myself love you,
and I give people in place of you,
and nations in place of your life.
You must not fear,
for I \add am\add* with you.
I will bring your ⸤offspring⸥\f + \fr 43:5 \ft Literally “seed” \f* from \add the\add* east,
and I will gather you from \add the\add* west.
I will say to the north, ‘Give!’
and to \add the\add* south, ‘You must not withhold!’
Bring my sons from far away,
and my daughters from the end of the earth—
everyone who is called by my name,
and whom I created for my glory,
whom I formed,
indeed whom I made.”
Bring out \add the\add* people blind yet\f + \fr 43:8 \ft Or “and” \f* with eyes,
and deaf, though\f + \fr 43:8 \ft Or “and” \f* they have ears.
Let all the nations gather together,
and let \add the\add* peoples assemble.
Who among them has declared this,
and ⸤declared⸥\f + \fr 43:9 \ft Literally “caused to hear” \f* \add the\add* former things to us?
Let them bring\f + \fr 43:9 \ft Or “give” \f* their witnesses, that\f + \fr 43:9 \ft Or “and” \f* they may be in the right,
and let them hear and say, “\add It is\add* true!”
“You \add are\add* my witnesses,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 43:10 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and my servant whom I have chosen
so that you may know and believe ⸤in⸥\f + \fr 43:10 \ft Literally “to” \f* me
and understand that I \add am\add* he.
No god was formed before ⸤me⸥\f + \fr 43:10 \ft Literally “my face” \f*,
and none shall be after me.
I myself \add am\add* Yahweh,
and there is no savior besides me!
I myself declared and saved,
and I ⸤proclaimed⸥.\f + \fr 43:12 \ft Literally “caused to hear” \f* And there was no ⸤strange god⸥\f + \fr 43:12 \ft Literally “stranger” \f* among you.
And you \add are\add* my witnesses,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 43:12 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and I \add am\add* God.
Indeed, from \add this\add* day I \add am\add* the one,
and no one can deliver from my hand.
I perform,\f + \fr 43:13 \ft Or “make” \f* and who can ⸤cancel it⸥?”\f + \fr 43:13 \ft Literally “bring it back” \f*
Yahweh Rescues His People
Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer,
the holy one of Israel:
“For your sake I will send \add to\add* Babylon,
and I will cause all of them to fall down \add as\add* fugitives,
and ⸤the Chaldeans⸥,\f + \fr 43:14 \ft Literally “Chaldea” \f* their rejoicing on the ships.
I \add am\add* Yahweh, your holy one,
the creator of Israel, your king.”
Thus says Yahweh, who ⸤makes⸥\f + \fr 43:16 \ft Literally “gives” \f* a way in the sea
and a path in \add the\add* mighty waters,
who brings out chariot and horse,
army and mighty one.
Together they lie down;
they cannot rise.
They are extinguished,
quenched like \add a\add* wick.
“You must not remember \add the\add* former things,
and you not must consider \add the\add* former things.
Look! I \add am\add* about to do a new thing! Now it sprouts!
Do you not perceive\f + \fr 43:19 \ft Or “know” \f* it?
Indeed, I will ⸤make⸥\f + \fr 43:19 \ft Literally “put” \f* a way in the wilderness,
rivers in \add the\add* desert.
The animals of the field will honor me,
jackals and daughters of \add the\add* ostrich,
for I give water in the wilderness,
rivers in \add the\add* desert,
to give a drink \add to\add* my chosen people,
this people whom I formed for myself,
so they might ⸤make known⸥\f + \fr 43:21 \ft Literally “count out” \f* my praise.
But\f + \fr 43:22 \ft Or “And” \f* you did not call me, Jacob;
for you have become weary of me, Israel.
You have not brought me your sheep for a burnt offering
nor\f + \fr 43:23 \ft Or “and” \f* honored me \add with\add* your sacrifice.
I have not made you serve with offerings,\f + \fr 43:23 \ft Hebrew “offering” \f*
nor have I made you weary with frankincense.
You have not bought me spice reed with money
or\f + \fr 43:24 \ft Or “and” \f* satisfied me \add with\add* the fat of sacrifices.
But you have burdened me with your sins;
you have made me weary with your iniquities.
I, I am the one who blots out your transgressions for my sake,
and I will not remember your sins.
Take me to court; let us enter into judgment together.
You, ⸤make an account⸥\f + \fr 43:26 \ft Literally “count up” \f* so that you may be in the right.
Your first ancestor\f + \fr 43:27 \ft Or “father” \f* sinned,
and your ⸤representatives⸥\f + \fr 43:27 \ft Literally “scoffers” or “spokesmen” \f* transgressed against me.
And I profaned \add the\add* princes of \add the\add* sanctuary,
and I gave Jacob to destruction, and Israel to reviling.
